page.title: 11MOTTRAM - Landscape
page.content: This is an ancient settlement, being set on "War Hill". Its original boundaries covered Longendale and east It is set at the head of all the important Pennine routes and thus became a thriving community service. However all that now remains is the "Pack Horse Inn". The woodland was mentioned in the previous Domesday Book, but was only stated as being fit for hunting. Yet it was both this and sheep rearing that continued to dominate the local economy. With the introduction of rail and road networks to the nerve centre of steel, Sheffield, Mottram and the surrounding areas were dragged into industrialisation.
